ITTIA DB IoT C API Reference  8.4.1

C API

The C API provides a low-level interface to the database kernel. More...

Modules

 Database
 A database contains tables, indexes, and sequences defined by the database schema.
 
 Data Types
 Like most database systems, ITTIA DB allows constraints to be put on data stored in the database.
 
 Schema
 The database schema is defined programmatically by describing the fields and indexes that make up a table.
 
 Data Access
 Data in an ITTIA DB database is accessed through cursors, both for reading and writing.
 
 Configuration
 Configuration options, at both compile-time and run-time can be set to achieve optimal database performance.
 
 Data Stream
 Data streams provide a way to query, filter, and store data in real time.

Detailed Description

The C API provides a low-level interface to the database kernel.

To access the C API, include ittia/db.h.

#include <ittia/db.h>
db.h
Entry point for the ITTIA DB C API.

Function Documentation

◆ db_init_ex()

int db_init_ex ( db_api_t  api_ver,
const db_init_t *  config 
)

Initialize the API and OS services layer.

Parameters
api_verCurrent API version. Always use DB_API_VER.
configDatabase library configuration options. Use NULL for default settings.
Returns
  • DB_NOERROR when successful.
  • DB_ESTATE API and OS services layer already initialized.
  • DB_EAPIVER Version mismatch: the ITTIA DB library is incompatible with the compiled program. The application may have been linked with an old version of the library that does not support new API features. Check for this error to ensure that the correct shared library or dynamic link library (DLL) version of ITTIA DB is loaded.

Call this function before invoking any other API functions.

When config is used, set any member to NULL to use the default settings for that member.

db_init_ex(DB_API_VER, NULL);
DB_API_VER
#define DB_API_VER
Current API version number.
Definition: db.h:67
db_init_ex
int db_init_ex(db_api_t api_ver, const db_init_t *config)
Initialize the API and OS services layer.

◆ db_done_ex()

int db_done_ex ( db_done_t *  info)

Finalize the API and OS services layer.

Parameters
infoDestination for final library statistics. Use the results to help identify resource and memory leaks when trace facilities are enabled. No statistics are collected if this parameter is NULL.
Returns
  • DB_NOERROR when successful.

Call this function when the database API is no longer needed.
